Plotting Functions (picmol.plotter)¶

picmol.plotter.get_cmap(xx, colormap: str = 'jet', levels: int = 40)[source]¶

Generates a color map based on the input data.

Parameters:

  • xx (numpy.ndarray) – Data to base the color map on.

  • colormap (str, optional) – Name of the color map. Defaults to ‘jet’.

  • levels (int, optional) – Number of color levels. Defaults to 40.

Returns:

A tuple containing the input data and the color map.

Return type:

tuple(numpy.ndarray, matplotlib.cm.ScalarMappable)

class picmol.plotter.KBIPlotter(model)[source]¶

A class for visualizing KBI (Kirkwood-Buff Integral) analysis results.

Parameters:

model (KBI) – KBI class object containing Kirkwood-Buff integrals and related data.

make_figures(show_fig: bool = False)[source]¶

Generates various KBI-related figures.

Parameters:

show_fig (bool, optional) – Whether to display the figures. Defaults to False.

make_indiv_kbi_plots(show_fig: bool = False)[source]¶

Plot of KBI as a function of distance r.

Parameters:

show_fig (bool, optional) – Whether to display the figures. Defaults to False.

plot_kbi_inf(show_fig: bool = False)[source]¶

Plot KBI extrapolated to infinity.

Parameters:

show_fig (bool, optional) – Whether to display the figures. Defaults to False.

plot_composition_kbis(basis, show_fig: bool = False)[source]¶

Plot KBI as a function of composition.

Parameters:

  • basis (str, optional) – Basis for plotting (‘mol’ or ‘vol’). Defaults to “mol”.

  • show_fig (bool, optional) – Whether to display the figures. Defaults to False.

plot_dln_gammas(basis, ylimits=[], show_fig: bool = False)[source]¶

Plot derivative of log activity coefficients with respect to composition.

Parameters:

  • basis (str, optional) – Basis for plotting (‘mol’ or ‘vol’). Defaults to “mol”.

  • ylimits (list, optional) – Bounds for y-axis plotted.

  • show_fig (bool, optional) – Whether to display the figures. Defaults to False.

plot_ln_gammas(basis, ylimits=[], show_fig: bool = False)[source]¶

Plot log activity coefficients as a function of composition.

Parameters:

  • basis (str, optional) – Basis for plotting (‘mol’ or ‘vol’). Defaults to “mol”.

  • ylimits (list, optional) – Bounds for y-axis plotted.

  • show_fig (bool, optional) – Whether to display the figures. Defaults to False.

plot_binary_Gex(basis, show_fig: bool = False)[source]¶

Plot excess Gibbs energy.

Parameters:

  • basis (str, optional) – Basis for plotting (‘mol’ or ‘vol’). Defaults to “mol”.

  • show_fig (bool, optional) – Whether to display the figures. Defaults to False.

plot_binary_excess_contributions(basis, show_fig: bool = False)[source]¶

Plot excess thermodynamic properties.

Parameters:

  • basis (str, optional) – Basis for plotting (‘mol’ or ‘vol’). Defaults to “mol”.

  • show_fig (bool, optional) – Whether to display the figures. Defaults to False.

plot_binary_thermo_model_comparisons(show_fig: bool = False)[source]¶

Plot Quartic, UNIFAC, and UNIQUAC enthalpic and entropic contributions to Gibbs mixing free energy.

Parameters:

show_fig (bool, optional) – Whether to display the figures. Defaults to False.

plot_UNIQUAC_IP_fit()[source]¶

Plot UNIQUAC \(\Delta G_{mix}\) and compares to results from KBI.

plot_NRTL_IP_fit()[source]¶

Plot NRTL \(\Delta G_{mix}\) and compares to results from KBI.

plot_FH_chi_fit()[source]¶

Plot Flory-Huggins \(\Delta G_{mix}\) and compares to results from KBI.

plot_quartic_fit()[source]¶

Plot Quartic \(\Delta G_{mix}\) and compares to results from KBI.

class picmol.plotter.PhaseDiagramPlotter(model)[source]¶

A class for visualizing phase behavior of thermodynamic models.

This plotter supports binary and ternary systems, generating various phase diagrams and related plots based on the provided thermodynamic model.

Initializes the PhaseDiagramPlotter with a thermodynamic model.

The model can be either a ThermoModel or a UNIFACThermoModel. It extracts solute location and name information from the model.

Parameters:

model (ThermoModel or UNIFACThermoModel) – An instance of ThermoModel or UNIFACThermoModel.

make_figures(T=300, colormap='jet', num_contours=40)[source]¶

Generates various phase diagrams and related figures based on the system dimensionality.

For binary systems, it generates plots of Gibbs mixing energy, selected points, phase diagrams (based on Gibbs energy and I0), and Widom lines. For ternary systems, it generates Gibbs mixing energy and I0 plots with and without spinodal/binodal information, and binodal curves as a function of temperature.

Parameters:

  • T (float, optional) – Temperature for ternary plots (default: 300 K).

  • colormap (str, optional) – Colormap to use for heatmap plots (default: ‘jet’).

  • num_contours (int, optional) – Number of contour lines for heatmap plots (default: 40).

Raises:

ValueError – If the number of components in the thermodynamic model is not 2 or 3.

binary_gmix(basis: str, show_fig: bool = False)[source]¶

Plot Gibbs mixing free energy with binodal and spinodal points as a function of temperature.

Parameters:

  • basis (str, optional) – Basis for plotting (‘mol’ or ‘vol’). Defaults to “mol”.

  • show_fig (bool, optional) – Whether to display the figures. Defaults to False.

binary_gmix_selectpts(basis: str, show_fig: bool = False)[source]¶

Plot Gibbs mixing free energy with binodal and spinodal points as a function of temperature, only highlighting a few points near the critical point.

Parameters:

  • basis (str, optional) – Basis for plotting (‘mol’ or ‘vol’). Defaults to “mol”.

  • show_fig (bool, optional) – Whether to display the figures. Defaults to False.

binary_phase_diagram_Gmix_heatmap(basis: str, num_contours=40, show_fig: bool = False)[source]¶

Plot heatmap of Gibbs mixing free energy with overlaid phase diagram as a function of temperature.

Parameters:

  • basis (str, optional) – Basis for plotting (‘mol’ or ‘vol’). Defaults to “mol”.

  • num_contours (int, optional) – Number of contours for heatmap. Defaults to 40.

  • show_fig (bool, optional) – Whether to display the figures. Defaults to False.

binary_phase_diagram_I0_heatmap(ymin: float = 0.01, ymax: float = 1.0, basis: str = 'vol', num_contours=40, show_fig: bool = False)[source]¶

Plot heatmap of SAXS \(I_o\) with overlaid phase diagram as a function of temperature.

Parameters:

  • ymin (float, optional) – lower bound y-limit

  • ymax (float, optional) – upper bound y-limit

  • basis (str, optional) – Basis for plotting (‘mol’ or ‘vol’). Defaults to “mol”.

  • num_contours (int, optional) – Number of contours for heatmap. Defaults to 40.

  • show_fig (bool, optional) – Whether to display the figures. Defaults to False.

binary_phase_diagram_I0_heatmap_widomline(ymin: float = 0.01, ymax: float = 1.0, basis: str = 'vol', num_contours=40, show_fig: bool = False)[source]¶

Plot heatmap of SAXS \(I_o\) with overlaid phase diagram and widom line as a function of temperature.

Parameters:

  • ymin (float, optional) – lower bound y-limit

  • ymax (float, optional) – upper bound y-limit

  • basis (str, optional) – Basis for plotting (‘mol’ or ‘vol’). Defaults to “mol”.

  • num_contours (int, optional) – Number of contours for heatmap. Defaults to 40.

  • show_fig (bool, optional) – Whether to display the figures. Defaults to False.

binary_phase_diagram(plot_Tmin=0, plot_Tmax=500, basis: str = 'vol', color='mediumblue', show_fig: bool = False)[source]¶

Plot temperature-composition phase diagram.

Parameters:

  • plot_Tmin (float, optional) – lower bound y-limit

  • plot_Tmax (float, optional) – upper bound y-limit

  • basis (str, optional) – Basis for plotting (‘mol’ or ‘vol’). Defaults to “mol”.

  • color (str, optional) – color for phase diagram. Defaults to “mediumblue”.

  • show_fig (bool, optional) – Whether to display the figures. Defaults to False.

binary_phase_diagram_widomline(plot_Tmin=0, plot_Tmax=500, basis: str = 'vol', color='mediumblue', show_fig: bool = False)[source]¶

Plot temperature-composition phase diagram with widom line.

Parameters:

  • plot_Tmin (float, optional) – lower bound y-limit

  • plot_Tmax (float, optional) – upper bound y-limit

  • basis (str, optional) – Basis for plotting (‘mol’ or ‘vol’). Defaults to “mol”.

  • color (str, optional) – color for phase diagram. Defaults to “mediumblue”.

  • show_fig (bool, optional) – Whether to display the figures. Defaults to False.

ternary_GM(T, plot_spbi: bool = False, num_contours: int = 20, colormap: str = 'jet', show_fig: bool = False)[source]¶

Plot heatmap of Gibbs mixing free energy for a ternary system at a given temperature (K).

Parameters:

  • plot_spbi (bool, optional) – add spinodal and binodal points to plot. Default to False.

  • num_contours (int, optional) – number of contours for heatmap. Defaults to 20.

  • colormap (str, optional) – colormap to use for heatmap. Defaults to “jet”.

  • show_fig (bool, optional) – Whether to display the figures. Defaults to False.

ternary_Io(T, plot_spbi: bool = False, num_contours: int = 20, colormap: str = 'jet', show_fig: bool = False)[source]¶

Plot heatmap of SAXS \(I_0\) for a ternary system at a given temperature (K).

Parameters:

  • plot_spbi (bool, optional) – add spinodal and binodal points to plot. Default to False.

  • num_contours (int, optional) – number of contours for heatmap. Defaults to 20.

  • colormap (str, optional) – colormap to use for heatmap. Defaults to “jet”.

  • show_fig (bool, optional) – Whether to display the figures. Defaults to False.

ternary_binodals_fTemp(colormap: str = 'jet', show_fig: bool = False)[source]¶

Plot ternary figure of heatmap of Gibbs mixing free energy for a ternary system as a function of temperature (K).

Parameters:

  • colormap (str, optional) – colormap to use for heatmap. Defaults to “jet”.

  • show_fig (bool, optional) – Whether to display the figures. Defaults to False.

ternary_plotly_GM_3D(colormap: str = 'jet', show_fig: bool = False)[source]¶

Plot 3D ternary figure using plotly of heatmap of Gibbs mixing free energy for a ternary system as a function of temperature (K).

Parameters:

  • colormap (str, optional) – colormap to use for heatmap. Defaults to “jet”.

  • show_fig (bool, optional) – Whether to display the figures. Defaults to False.

ternary_plotly_GM_flat(colormap: str = 'rainbow', num_contours: int = 40, show_fig: bool = False)[source]¶

Plot flat ternary figure using plotly of heatmap of Gibbs mixing free energy for a ternary system as a function of temperature (K).

Parameters:

  • colormap (str, optional) – colormap to use for heatmap. Defaults to “jet”.

  • show_fig (bool, optional) – Whether to display the figures. Defaults to False.
